profileText: a Representative from Illinois; born in Lebanon, Warren County, Ohio, January 12, 1818; attended private schools; studied law; was admitted to the bar in 1839 and practiced in Wilmington, Ohio; member of the Ohio state house of representatives, 1846-1847; member of the Ohio state senate, 1847-1849; moved to Peru, La Salle County, Ill., in 1857; member of the Illinois state house of representatives, 1865-1870, speaker, 1867-1870; elected as a Republican to the Forty-third Congress (March 4, 1873-March 3, 1875); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the Forty-fourth Congress in 1874; resumed the practice of his profession in Peru, Ill.; died on June 15, 1879, in Peru, Ill.; interment in Peru City Cemetery, Peru, Ill.
